trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with PolicyStat | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with PolicyStat | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use PolicyStat with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use PolicyStat with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with PolicyStat
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with PolicyStat

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and PolicyStat.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and PolicyStat.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A PolicyStat tenant
trans-unit.target: A PolicyStat tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to PolicyStat will be able to single sign into the application at your PolicyStat company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to PolicyStat will be able to single sign into the application at your PolicyStat company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for PolicyStat
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for PolicyStat

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for PolicyStat
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for PolicyStat

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for PolicyStat.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for PolicyStat.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for PolicyStat, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for PolicyStat, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type PolicyStat.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type PolicyStat.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select PolicyStat, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select PolicyStat, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>PolicyStat</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>PolicyStat</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to PolicyStat with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to PolicyStat with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Your PolicyStat application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your saml token attributes configuration.
trans-unit.target: Your PolicyStat application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your saml token attributes configuration.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows an example for this.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows an example for this.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the PolicyStat application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the PolicyStat application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to PolicyStat page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to PolicyStat page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App Settings page, in the Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign-on to your URL PolicyStat application (e.g.: “https://demo-azure.policystat.com”), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App Settings page, in the Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign-on to your URL PolicyStat application (e.g.: “https://demo-azure.policystat.com”), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at PolicyStat page, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at PolicyStat page, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your PolicyStat company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your PolicyStat company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Click the Admin tab, and then click Single Sign-On Configuration in left navigation pane.
trans-unit.target: Click the Admin tab, and then click Single Sign-On Configuration in left navigation pane.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administrator Menu</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administrator Menu</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Setup section, select Enable Single Sign-on Integration.
trans-unit.target: In the Setup section, select Enable Single Sign-on Integration.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On Configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On Configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Configure Attributes, and then, in the Configure Attributes section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Click Configure Attributes, and then, in the Configure Attributes section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On Configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On Configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Username Attribute textbox, type uid.
trans-unit.target: In the Username Attribute textbox, type uid.

trans-unit.source: In the First Name Attribute textbox, type firstname.
trans-unit.target: In the First Name Attribute textbox, type firstname.

trans-unit.source: In the Last Name Attribute textbox, type lastname.
trans-unit.target: In the Last Name Attribute textbox, type lastname.

trans-unit.source: In the Email Attribute textbox, type emailaddress.
trans-unit.target: In the Email Attribute textbox, type emailaddress.

trans-unit.source: Click Save Changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Save Changes.

trans-unit.source: Click Your IDP Metadata, and then, in the Your IDP Metadata section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Click Your IDP Metadata, and then, in the Your IDP Metadata section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On Configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On Configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Open your downloaded metadata file, copy the content, and then paste it into the Your Identity Provider Metadata textbox
trans-unit.target: Open your downloaded metadata file, copy the content, and then paste it into the Your Identity Provider Metadata textbox

trans-unit.source: Click Save Changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Save Changes.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To add the required attribute mappings, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To add the required attribute mappings, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click add user attribute.
trans-unit.target: Click add user attribute.

trans-unit.source: In the Attribute Name textbox, type uid.
trans-unit.target: In the Attribute Name textbox, type uid.

trans-unit.source: In the Attribute Value textbox, select ExtractMailPrefix().
trans-unit.target: In the Attribute Value textbox, select ExtractMailPrefix().

trans-unit.source: From the Mail list, select User.mail.
trans-unit.target: From the Mail list, select User.mail.

trans-unit.source: Click Complete.
trans-unit.target: Click Complete.

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into PolicyStat, they must be provisioned into PolicyStat.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into PolicyStat, they must be provisioned into PolicyStat.

trans-unit.source: PolicyStat supports just in time user provisioning.
trans-unit.target: PolicyStat supports just in time user provisioning.

trans-unit.source: This means, you do not need to add the users manually to PolicyStat.
trans-unit.target: This means, you do not need to add the users manually to PolicyStat.

trans-unit.source: The users will get added automatically on their first login through single sign on.
trans-unit.target: The users will get added automatically on their first login through single sign on.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other PolicyStat user account creation tools or APIs provided by PolicyStat to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other PolicyStat user account creation tools or APIs provided by PolicyStat to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to PolicyStat, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to PolicyStat, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the PolicyStat **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the PolicyStat **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
